hypothesis_content.title: L2 Breakout Failure Fade on False Volume Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: When an L2 token (MATIC, ARB, OP) breaks above 10-day high on 1h chart with volume spike > 200% of 20-period average, but fails to hold breakout (closes back below breakout level within 2 hours) and 1h RSI(14) shows bearish divergence (price higher high, RSI lower high), fading the failed breakout yields >3% return over next 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: False breakouts with volume spikes often indicate stop hunts or failed accumulation. Bearish RSI divergence confirms weakening momentum. Quick failure suggests lack of follow-through buying. Fading these failed moves capitalizes on trapped longs liquidating.
entry_conditions: L2 token breaks above 10-day high on 1h chart
Price closes back below breakout level within 2 hours
1h RSI(14) shows bearish divergence (price makes higher high, RSI makes lower high)
BTC 4h chart not in strong uptrend (price < 20-period MA)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reclaims and holds above breakout level for 2 consecutive 1h closes

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 45% of failed breakouts immediately reverse and continue upward, or average win rate < 52% in intraday testing.
